data.name: developed_by
data.value: Developed By

data.name: home_howitworks_body
data.value: The solution for addiction to many substances has been found for many through the 12 steps of alcoholics anonymous. With the help of the steps, we have found not only freedom from addictions that make our existence unbearable but a sense of comfort inside our skin. We say the program is simple, but it isn't necessarily easy. We are NOT religious. We do not support ANY causes. We want to help each other recover from the strong grip of addiction!

data.name: home_howitworks_title
data.value: There is a Solution

data.name: home_literature_body
data.value: Written by marijuana addicts and for marijuana addicts, download pdfs of our literature for free directly from the site.

data.name: home_literature_button
data.value: Literature

data.name: home_literature_title
data.value: There is plenty to read to get started

data.name: home_meetings_body
data.value: One of the most important components of staying sober is going to meetings and connecting with other addicts who are also trying to stay sober. As a young fellowship in Montreal, we only have a few meetings, but what we lack in quantity, we make up for in quality. Many people who are sober today have come through the rooms of MA in Montreal. Going to meetings helps you escape the isolation that often accompanies addiction. It is also a way of deciding for yourself whether or not this program could work for you. Do yourself a favor if you think you have a problem with marijuana, and join us <3!

data.name: home_meetings_title
data.value: Find a meeting near you

data.name: home_seekhelp_body
data.value: Our program teaches us that the only way we can stay sober is to help the still-suffering marijuana addict. By contacting us, you allow us to stay clean. Even if it might be difficult to admit to marijuana addiction, it may be the most important first step to getting your life back on track. Be strong, but do not do it alone.

data.name: seek_help_title
data.value: Reach out to Us

data.name: seek_help_body
data.value: Our program teaches us that the only way we can stay sober is to help the still-suffering marijuana addict. By contacting us, you allow us to stay clean. Even if it might be difficult to admit to marijuana addiction, it may be the most important first step to getting your life back on track. Be strong, but do not do it alone.

data.name: email_us
data.value: Email us

data.name: call_us
data.value: Call us

data.name: hiw_step_1
data.value: We admitted we were powerless over marijuana, that our lives had become unmanageable.

data.name: hiw_step_2
data.value: Came to believe that a Power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity.

data.name: hiw_preamble
data.value: The practice of rigorous honesty, of opening our hearts and minds, and the willingness to go to any lengths to have a spiritual awakening are essential to our recovery. Our old ideas and ways of life no longer work for us. Our suffering shows us that we need to let go absolutely. We surrender ourselves to a Power greater than ourselves. Here are the steps we take which are suggested for recovery:

data.name: hiw_postamble
data.value: Do not be discouraged; none of us are saints. Our program is not easy, but it is simple. We strive for progress, not perfection. Our experiences, before and after we entered recovery, teach us three important ideas:

data.name: hiw_idea_1
data.value: That we are marijuana addicts and cannot manage our own lives;

data.name: hiw_idea_2
data.value: That probably no human power can relieve our addiction; and

data.name: hiw_idea_3
data.value: That our Higher Power can and will if sought

data.name: hiw_step_3
data.value: Made a decision to turn our will and our lives over to the care of God, as we understood God.

data.name: hiw_step_4
data.value: Made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.

data.name: hiw_step_6
data.value: Were entirely ready to have God remove all these defects of character.

data.name: hiw_step_7
data.value: Humbly asked God to remove our shortcomings.

data.name: hiw_step_8
data.value: Made a list of all persons we had harmed, and became willing to make amends to them all.

data.name: hiw_step_9
data.value: Made direct amends to such people wherever possible, except when to do so would injure them or others.

data.name: hiw_step_10
data.value: Continued to take personal inventory and when we were wrong, promptly admitted it.

data.name: hiw_step_11
data.value: Sought through prayer and meditation to improve our conscious contact with God, as we understood God, praying only for knowledge of God’s will for us and the power to carry that out.

data.name: hiw_step_12
data.value: Having had a spiritual awakening as the result of these steps, we tried to carry this message to marijuana addicts and to practice these principles in all our affairs.

data.name: hiw_step_5
data.value: Admitted to God, to ourselves, and to another human being the exact nature of our wrongs.

data.name: 12_promises_title
data.value: The Promises

data.name: 12_promises_preamble
data.value: If we are painstaking about this phase of our development, we will be amazed before we are half way through.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_1
data.value: We are going to know a new freedom and a new happiness.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_2
data.value: We will not regret the past nor wish to shut the door on it.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_3
data.value: We will comprehend the word serenity.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_4
data.value: We will know peace.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_5
data.value: No matter how far down the scale we have gone, we will see how our experience can benefit others.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_6
data.value: That feeling of uselessness and self-pity will disappear

data.name: 12_promises_promise_7
data.value: We will lose interest in selfish things and gain interest in our fellows.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_8
data.value: Self-seeking will slip away.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_9
data.value: Our whole attitude and outlook on life will change.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_10
data.value: Fear of people and economic insecurity will leave us.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_11
data.value: We will intuitively know how to handle situations which used to baffle us.

data.name: 12_promises_promise_12
data.value: We will suddenly realize that God is doing for us what we could not do for ourselves

data.name: 12_promises_postamble
data.value: Are these extravagant promises? We think not. They are being fulfilled among us—sometimes quickly, sometimes slowly. They will always materialize if we work for them.

data.name: 12_questions_title
data.value: The questions

data.name: 12_questions_preamble
data.value: The following questions may help you determine whether marijuana is a problem in your life.

data.name: 12_questions_question_1
data.value: Has smoking pot stopped being fun?

data.name: 12_questions_question_2
data.value: Do you ever get high alone?

data.name: 12_questions_question_3
data.value: Is it hard for you to imagine a life without marijuana?

data.name: 12_questions_question_4
data.value: Do you find that your friends are determined by your marijuana use?

data.name: 12_questions_question_5
data.value: Do you smoke marijuana to avoid dealing with your problems? see how our experience can benefit others.

data.name: 12_questions_question_6
data.value: Do you smoke pot to cope with your feelings?

data.name: 12_questions_question_7
data.value: Does your marijuana use let you live in a privately defined world?

data.name: 12_questions_question_8
data.value: Have you ever failed to keep promises you made about cutting down or controlling your dope smoking?

data.name: 12_questions_question_9
data.value: Has your use of marijuana caused problems with memory, concentration, or motivation?

data.name: 12_questions_question_10
data.value: When your stash is nearly empty, do you feel anxious or worried about how to get more?

data.name: 12_questions_question_11
data.value: Do you plan your life around your marijuana use?

data.name: 12_questions_question_12
data.value: Have friends or relatives ever complained that your pot smoking is damaging your relationship with them?

data.name: 12_questions_postamble
data.value: If you answered yes to any of the above questions, you may have a problem with marijuana.

data.name: 12_traditions_title
data.value: The Traditions

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_1
data.value: Our common welfare should come first; personal recovery depends upon MA unity.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_2
data.value: For our group purpose there is but one ultimate authority, a loving God whose expression may come through in our group conscience. Our leaders are but trusted servants; they do not govern.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_3
data.value: The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop using marijuana.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_4
data.value: Each group should be autonomous except in matters affecting other groups or MA as a whole.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_5
data.value: Each group has but one primary purpose, to carry its message to the marijuana addict who still suffers.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_6
data.value: MA groups ought never endorse, finance, or lend the MA name to any related facility or outside enterprise, lest problems of money, property, and prestige divert us from our primary purpose.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_7
data.value: Every MA group ought to be fully self-supporting, declining outside contributions.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_8
data.value: Marijuana Anonymous should remain forever nonprofessional, but our service centers may employ special workers.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_9
data.value: MA, as such, ought never be organized, but we may create service boards or committees directly responsible to those they serve.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_10
data.value: Marijuana Anonymous has no opinion on outside issues; hence the MA name ought never be drawn into public controversy.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_11
data.value: Our public relations policy is based upon attraction rather than promotion; we need always maintain personal anonymity at the level of press, radio, TV, film, and other public media. We need guard with special care the anonymity of all fellow MA members.

data.name: 12_traditions_tradition_12
data.value: Anonymity is the spiritual foundation of all our traditions, ever reminding us to place principles before personalities.If we are painstaking about this phase of our development, we will be amazed before we are half way through.
